sections.title: MBBS Admission in Chandigarh 2024-25, Colleges Seat Matrix, Fee Structure, Application process, Cut-off and Counselling
Chandigarh MBBS Admission 2024-25: Overview

content.content: Chandigarh is a bustling center of industry, innovation, and education, celebrated for its vibrant culture, storied past, and significant economic contributions to India. Its capital.

Renowned as a premier destination for medical education in India, Chandigarh offers a plethora of undergraduate and postgraduate medical programs, drawing students from all corners of the nation. Admission to MBBS programs in Chandigarh is conducted through the NEET exam, with successful candidates participating in state counseling for enrollment.

The MBBS curriculum in Chandigarh spans 5.5 years, comprising 4.5 years of academic study and 1 year of compulsory internship, providing students with comprehensive training and practical experience.In Chandigarh aspiring MBBS students have a variety of options available for admission. The state boasts both government and private medical colleges and universities. Typically, securing admission into government medical colleges is more competitive than private ones, resulting in higher cut-off marks for government institutions.

The total number of MBBS seats in Chandigarh can vary each year due to factors such as government policies, changes in infrastructure, and accreditation of new medical colleges. For MBBS Admission Chandigarh total 250 seats are available in Government and private Medical Colleges in Chandigarh. The state has 0 AIIMS and 1 Government and 1 Private Medical Colleges.

In the following sections, we will delve into the specifics of MBBS admission for the academic year 2024-25 in Chandigarh including details on college seat matrix, fee structure, application process, cut-off marks, and counseling procedures. For personalized assistance with MBBS admission in India or abroad, feel free to reach out to our dedicated admission counseling team at MBBS APP.

sections.title: MBBS Admission in Chandigarh 2024-25: Highlights

content.content: Chandigarh has a total of 2 Medical Colleges, including 1 Government Medical Colleges, 0 AIIMS (All India Institute of Medical Sciences), 0 Deemed University and 1 Private Medical Colleges. The government medical colleges offer 150 MBBS seats, while the private medical colleges offer 100 MBBS seats.

content.table:
Application modeOnline
Admission CriteriaNational Entrance Exam
Entrance ExamNational Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET)
Examination AuthorityNational Testing Agency (NTA)
Total College Count2 (Including Govt & Private)
Number of SeatsMBBS- 250 (Including Govt & Private)
Admission ProcessThe admission process will be conducted through online counselling by the State Common Entrance Test Cell – Chandigarh.
+91 80946-06060
Rounds of State CounsellingThere will be Four Rounds of Counselling for the state quota seats. The first round of counselling will be held in July 2023, the second round in August 2023, and the Third & Fourth Round in September 2023.
Selection CriteriaCandidates will be selected based on their NEET-UG score and the reservation criteria.
Top MBBS CollegesGovernment Medical College, Chandigarh

content.table:
Admission FeeTotal Charges: US $1,10,000 + US $1,000 registration charges
Other Annual FeesIn addition to the above mentioned admission fee, Foreign Indian Students will be charged other fees including tuition fee as applicable to General Category Indian Citizen students admitted in UT Chandigarh Pool. This fee can be paid in Indian rupees also.College security (Refundable) of INR 50,000/- will be charged from Foreign Indian Student at the time of admission which will be refunded after completion of the course.

sections.title: College Wise NEET Cutoff (AIQ/SQ) 2023

content.content: The NEET cutoff is determined based on various factors such as the number of applicants, the difficulty level of the exam, and the availability of seats in medical and dental colleges. It varies for different categories like General, OBC, SC, ST, and others. Each state and college may also have its own cutoff scores. Generally, higher cutoffs are seen in prestigious colleges and for popular courses. It’s crucial for aspiring medical students to keep track of cutoff trends and prepare accordingly

sections.title: MBBS Admission Chandigarh: College Wise Cut-off (Rank)

content.content: To get into the MBBS programs at Chandigarh prestigious medical colleges, you need to know the college-specific cut-offs (ranks). sections.title: Application Form for Chandigarh MBBS Admission 2024-25

content.list:
• The application form must be filled out entirely online. Only online application fees are accepted from students.
  • The MBBS Admission Chandigarh Application Form is now available, and candidates can submit their applications till the deadline.
  • In order to register for the Chandigarh MBBS 2024 application form, applicants must input their personal, academic, NEET 2024 score, and other information. The authority will announce the merit ranking and adhere to the procedure of document verification, choice-filling, and place-allocation.
  • Candidates must bring a hard copy of their admissions application along with all Original Documents when they report to the designated medical or dental college; otherwise, their application will be rejected/disqualified without further communication.

sections.title: Application Fees & Security Deposit for MBBS Admission Chandigarh 2024-25

content.content: Application fees for NEET UG Counselling can be paid online through the official website of Directorate of Medical Education & Research Chandigarh during the registration window for each counselling round. Category wise application fee for Chandigarh NEET UG Counselling is as follows:

content.table:
ParticularGeneral & other categoriesSC categoryForeign Indian Student / NRI
Category
Application Fee2,000/- + Bank Charges, if any1000/- + Bank Charges, if any14,000/- + Bank Charges, if any

content.content: Note- This fee can be paid online through the official website of Directorate of Medical Education & Research Chandigarh during the registration window for each counselling round.

The security deposit in Chandigarh NEET UG Counselling serves various purposes. It ensures a fair, effective, and financially sustainable process for a larger range of qualified applicants by discouraging seat blocking, encouraging commitment and thwarting fraud. This financial commitment benefits everyone in the long run by preserving an open and trustworthy system for medical college admissions. Details of Security deposit is as follows: -Application fees for NEET UG Counselling can be paid online through the official website of Directorate of Medical Education & Research Chandigarh during the registration window for each counselling round. Make sure to refer to the latest official documents or contact the concerned authorities directly for the most accurate information.

sections.title: Application Process for MBBS Admission Chandigarh
MBBS Admission Chandigarh Eligibility Criteria

content.list:
• The candidate must be an Indian National.
  • The candidate must be registered online application on website of State.
  • Indian Citizen
  • Overseas Citizen of India (OCI) Candidate will be eligible for Government / Corporation / Government Aided / Private unaided college for academic year 2024-25.
  • Those who want to apply must have a 10+2 in the science stream from a recognized board.
  • Those who want to apply for Chandigarh MBBS Admission must have taken Biology as a required course and have a minimum of 50% overall marks.
  • Those who want to apply must take the NEET Exam. From the 2023–24 academic year on, there is no upper age limit to take the NEET exam.

sections.title: Document Required for MBBS Admission Chandigarh

content.list:
• Score Sheet for NEET 2023
  • NEET Admission Ticket
  • Letter of Assignment
  • 12th class card and passing certificate
  • Grade Card and Passing Certificate for Grade 10
  • All grade reports for classes 11 and 12, if they were passed in more than one attempt.
  • A copy of a photo identification card, such as a driver’s licence, PAN card, electoral card, government or public utility card, school ID card, or Aadhar card.
  • Valid caste certificate, sub-category certificate, if applicable
  • Certificate of domicile, if applicable
  • 4 passport size photographs same as affixed on application form
  • Character certification from the previous study institution
  • Migration Certificate from the previous study institution
  • The MBBS admission process in Chandigarh is a competitive one, but it is also a fair one. All candidates who meet the eligibility criteria have a chance to be admitted to a medical college in the state.
